ArticleTitle.sentence: Role of cellular tumor necrosis factor receptor-associated factors in NF-kappaB activation and lymphocyte transformation by herpesvirus Saimiri STP.

AbstractText.sentence: The STP oncoproteins of the herpesvirus saimiri (HVS) subgroup A strain 11 and subgroup C strain 488 are now found to be stably associated with tumor necrosis factor receptor-associated factor (TRAF) 1, 2, or 3.

event.clue: The STP oncoproteins of the herpesvirus saimiri (HVS) subgroup A strain 11 and subgroup C strain 488 are now found to be stably associated with tumor necrosis factor receptor-associated factor (TRAF) 1, 2, or 3.

AbstractText.sentence: Mutational analyses identified residues of PXQXT/S in STP-A11 as critical for TRAF association.

event.clue: Mutational analyses identified residues of PXQXT/S in STP-A11 as critical for TRAF association.
Mutational analyses identified residues of PXQXT/S in STP-A11 as critical for TRAF association.

AbstractText.sentence: In addition, a somewhat divergent region of STP-C488 is critical for TRAF association.

event.clue: In addition, a somewhat divergent region of STP-C488 is critical for TRAF association.

AbstractText.sentence: Mutational analysis also revealed that STP-C488 induced NF-kappaB activation that was correlated with its ability to associate with TRAFs.

AbstractText.sentence: The HVS STP-C488 P10-->R mutant was deficient in human T-lymphocyte transformation to interleukin-2-independent growth but showed wild-type phenotype for marmoset T-lymphocyte transformation in vitro and in vivo.

AbstractText.sentence: The STP-C488 P10-->R mutant was also defective in Rat-1 fibroblast transformation, and fibroblast cell transformation was blocked by a TRAF2 dominant-negative mutant.
